properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR GOLDEN The Ministry of Environment & Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with the Interior Health Authority has issued a Dust Advisory for Golden because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation, dust suppression or a change in traffic patterns. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Exposure is particularly a concern for individuals with chronic conditions such as asthma, COPD, heart disease, and diabetes; respiratory infections such as COVID-19, pregnant women, infants, and older adults. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions or acute infections should postpone or reduce strenuous exercise until the advisory is lifted. Where appropriate, maintain physical distancing. Anyone experiencing symptoms such as continuing eye or throat irritation, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, cough or wheezing, should follow the advice of their health care provider. Staying indoors helps to reduce particulate matter exposure. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-landwater/air. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2021-03-16T03:30:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2021-03-15T11:31:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0883743940.2021
Area: East Columbia
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Brief, intense snowfall is expected. Visibilities will be rapidly reduced due to the heavy snow. Further snowfall: 5 cm except 20 to 30 in snow squalls. Locations: the tip of Cape St. Francis, the Bay de Verde Peninsula, and the Clarenville vicinity. Time span: today and this evening. Remarks: A snow squall from the northern Avalon Peninsula to the Clarenville vicinity is expected to meander around the general area today. Potentially significant accumulations are possible under this squall. Conditions are expected to improve this evening as the squall dissipates. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-03-16T04:59:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-15T13:20:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1936298321.2021
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, St. John's and vicinity, Clarenville and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Brief, intense snowfall is expected. Visibilities will be rapidly reduced due to the heavy snow. Further snowfall: 2 to 4 cm except 10 cm in snow squalls. Locations: the tip of Cape St. Francis, the Bay de Verde Peninsula, the Clarenville vicinity, Bonavista Peninsula, and Terra Nova region. Time span: this evening. Remarks: A snow squall over the Bonavista Peninsula extending to Terra Nova is expected to slowly move southward this evening. Potentially significant accumulations are possible under this squall. Conditions are expected to improve later this evening as the squall dissipates. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-03-16T04:59:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-15T18:27:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0687095216.2021
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, St. John's and vicinity, Bonavista Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity, Terra Nova
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy snow continues to fall at Arviat. An additional 5 to 10 cm is forecast to fall tonight, putting total accumulations in the 15 to 25 cm range by early Tuesday morning when the snow will exit the region. In addition to the snow, moderate southerly winds gusting up to 70 km/h are giving poor visibilities in blowing snow. Blowing snow will continue on Tuesday as winds switch to northwesterly in the wake of this system. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-16T11:27:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-15T19:28:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2126700790.2021
Area: Arviat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long period of snowfall with total amounts of about 20 cm is expected. A storm system will bring periods of light snow and gusty winds to the South Klondike Highway today with 5 cm forecast to fall. This system is forecast to intensify and give heavy snow to the region tonight with near 15 cm expected. Snow and blowing snow should ease to scattered flurries Tuesday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-16T05:56:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-15T13:57:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1345995188.2021
Area: South Klondike Highway - Carcross to White Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Flurries combined with northwesterly winds will produce reduced visibilities this evening. Conditions should gradually improve overnight. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-16T10:59:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-15T19:36:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2759960149.2021
Area: Grande-Vallée area, Sainte-Anne-des-Monts area, Murdochville area, Forillon National Park - Gaspé area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Strong easterly winds gusting to 80 km/h are bringing blizzard conditions. Winds will diminish this afternoon and the visibility will improve. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-15T23:14:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-15T12:17:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1305954660.2021
Area: Ulukhaktok
